newsitem.title: JAPAN: Man cut off finger to fake kidnap - Japanese police.
newsitem.headline: Man cut off finger to fake kidnap - Japanese police.

text.p: A 39-year-old man alleged to have cut off his finger and mailed it to family members in order to fake his own kidnapping, was arrested on Thursday.
Toru Odajima, who described himself as a shoe designer, was arrested at a Tokyo hotel on suspicion of faking personal data and other charges, a police spokesman said.
Police tracked down Odajima after he left a fingerprint on a form at a hospital where he sought treatment for the finger he cut from his left hand, the spokesman said.
Odajima left his house on September 25 with a man who he claimed was a police officer.

Nearly three weeks later, his wife received a telephone call demanding 50 million yen ($450,000) in ransom. The family received six more calls and eight letters all threatening that Odajima would be killed if the ransom was not paid.
The seventh letter was in a package containing Odajima's left ring finger.
